Enhancing business automation with integration
300-level live demo

 ); | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation and the IBM Cloud Pak for Integration can be combined to streamline a customer account opening process. To illustrate this combination, application integration is added to an existing workflow implementation. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation (CP4BA); Cloud Pak for Integration (CP4I) | | **Demo capabilities** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation: Workflow

Cloud Pak for Integration: API management; Application integration; Messaging (IBM MQ) | | **Demo script** | A complete demo script is on the second tab above.

This demo script has multiple tasks that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **Required versions** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation

Cloud Pak for Integration V2022.2 | | **How to get support** | **For IBMers:**
• Contact #itz-techzone-support or techzone.help@ibm.com regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo.

**For Business Partners:**
• Contact Tech Zone Support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning Tech Zone environments.
• Contact Automation Platinum Demos Support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo. | ## **INSTALL THE DEMO: Cloud Pak for Business Automation**
1 - Provision a Technology Zone demo environment
Reserve a Technology Zone demo environment here.
The Technology Zone provided environment contains two Windows virtual machines:
1. Business Automation Workflow (BAW) VM
2. RPA Client VM (the password for the Administrator account is **il0vedem0s**)
NOTE: Only the Business Automation Workflow (BAW) VM is needs for this demo.
**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Import the signer certificate for CP4I
1. Use Firefox to open the **WebSphere Console**. In the Firefox bookmarks bar, open **BAW** -> **WebSphere Integrated Solutions Console**.

2. Enter '**admin**' as the **User ID** and '**admin**' as the **Password**.

3. Open **Security** (1) and click **SSL certificate and key management** (2).

4. Click **Key stores and certificates**.

5. Click **CellDefaultTrustStore**.

6. Click **Signer certificates**.

7. Click **Retrieve from port**.

8. For **Host**, enter your CP4I ROKS hostname. For **Port**, enter '**443**'. For **Alias**, enter '**integration-1**'. Click **Retrieve signer information**.

9. Click **Apply**.

10. Click **Save**.

11. The new certificate is now added.

**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Update the 'AccountsServer' name in the process app settings

Update the API key.

**[Go to top](#top)**
## **INSTALL THE DEMO: Cloud Pak for Integration**
1 - Provision Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud for Cloud Pak for Integration
Provision Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud (ROKS) ready to install the Cloud Pak for Integration. To provision your ROKS instance, follow these steps:
1. To provision a ROKS cluster, go here and complete the form.
2. You will receive a confirmation email confirming the instance is provisioning.
3. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. You should expect this to take between 30 and 120 minutes. This email contains information, such as URLs, allowing you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact #itz-techzone-support.
**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Install the Cloud Pak for Integration on ROKS
1. Click the **Cluster URL** from the environment confirmation email. Log into IBM Cloud using your IBMid.

2. After you are logged in, click here to install Cloud Pak for Integration.

Make sure you are in an **ITZ** account (1) and the **Product version** is **2022.2.1** (2).

3. Scroll down to the **Select your cluster** section. From the list, select the **Red Hat OpenShift Cluster** (1) that you just created and click **Add project** (2).

4. Enter '**cp4i**' as the **Project** name (1). Click **Add** (2).
5. Scroll down to the **Set the deployment values** section and toggle the **Use an existing secret?** slider to **No** (1). Enter a value for **csDefaultAdminPassword** (2). It is important that you choose a password that is 32 characters in length and is composed of only letters and numbers. You will need this password in step 12.
NOTE: Password validation is currently not enforced on this page. If you proceed with an invalid password, you will be able to start the installation, but it will fail. There is no way to recover from this error other than provisioning a new cluster.

6. Scroll down to **Optional deployment values**. Click the collapsible section to open them. First, we will select the appropriate parameters for this specific demo:

1. **cognitiveCarRepairDemo**: Set to ‘**true**’
2. **drivewayDentDeletionDemo**: Set to ‘**false**’
3. **eventEnabledInsuranceDemo**: Set to ‘**false**’
4. **mappingAssistDemo**: Set to ‘**false**’
5. **weatherChatbotDemo**: Set to ‘**false**’

7. Continue to change the parameters and values:

NOTE: If you don’t have an SMTP email server and accounts that you can use, you may sign up for a free Mailtrap.io account. Mailtrap.io is a free cloud service that mimics an SMTP server. It is used for development/demonstration purposes only.

1. demoAPICMailServerHost: If you’re using mailtrap, leave this as 'smtp.mailtrap.io.'
2. demoAPICMailServerPort: If you’re using mailtrap, leave this as '2525.'
3. demoAPICEmailAddress: If you’re using mailtrap, you can use any email address. The dummy address ’apicadmin@example.com’ is recommended. If you’re using your own mail server, use an email address that you can receive and read.
4. demoAPICMialServerUsername: Set this to your SMTP mailtrap username. This is different from your mailtrap login username and can be found by using these instructions.
5. demoAPICMailServerPassword: Set this to your SMTP mailtrap password. This is different from your mailtrap login password and can be found by using these instructions.


8. **Accept** the license agreement (1) and click **Install** (2) to install Cloud Pak for Integration. The installation will take up to 150 minutes.

9. You can view the progress in the Schematics progress bar (1), or check the details by clicking **View log** (2).

10. When the status is **Active**, you will be able to access Cloud Pak for Integration Platform Navigator. Select **Offering Dashboard** on the upper right corner of the page.

11. On the login page, select the **IBM provided credentials (admin only)** authentication type.

12. Use the admin userid and password (1) you created in step 5, and click **Log in** (2).

13. Click **Integration instances**.

14. The parts of the Cloud Pak (API Connect, App Connect Designer, App Connect Dashboard, and Asset Repository) will display here. Additional instances for any of the integration capabilities can be created by selecting **Create an instance**.

You have successfully completed cluster provisioning, installation of Cloud Pak for Integration, and deployment of API Connect and App Connect. You are ready to proceed. **[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Prerequisites and preparing your Cloud Pak for Integration environment
**Deploy IBM MQ**
In this section, you will access your ROKS cluster and install IBM MQ configured ready for App Connect.
1. Open My reservations in **IBM Technology Zone**.
2. Select your **CP4I ROKS** cluster.

3. Click **Open your IBM Cloud environment**.

4. Click **OpenShift web console**.

5. On the web console, click **+** (1), the content of this file into the screen (2), and select **Create** (3).

**Configure the certificates for communication**
The default certificates configured for IBM API Connect do not advertise the hostname, and this can cause issues when invoking APIs. Let’s configure the right certificate.
1. Open the **Workload** folder (1) and select **Secrets** (2). In the filter box, type '**ademo-gw-gateway**' (3), and select the corresponding entry (4).

2. Scroll down and you will see three entries.

3. Open two text editors. Copy **ca.crt** (1) and **tls.key** (2) into a file, and save it with the file name '**key.private.pem**' (3). Then, copy **tls.crt** (4) in another file, and save it with the file name '**key.public.pem**' (5).

4. Open the Cloud Pak for Integration home page from section 2 above. Using the menu in the top left, expand **Administration** and select **Integration instances**.

5. Select **ademo** with the **API management administration** type.

6. If necessary, log in again using the Common Services User Registry option. Click the **Resources** icon (1) and then **TLS** (2).

7. Scroll down to the **Keystore** section and click **Create**.

8. For the **Title**, enter '**Custom Gateway Keystore**.'

9. Scroll down to the **Private key & public key** section. For the **Step 1: Upload private key** section, upload **key.private.pem** (1). For the **Step 2: Upload public key** section, upload **key.public.pem** (2). Click **Save** (3).

10. Scroll to the top of the **TLS** section, and click **Default TLS server profile**.

11. Scroll to the **Keystore/truststore** section. In the pull down, select **Custom Gateway Keystore**.

12. Scroll down and click **Save**.

**Connect CP4I to your endpoints**
Now, let's configure our services endpoints in Cloud Pak for Integration.
1. In the menu on the top left, open the **Design** folder (1) and select **Integrations** (2).

2. Open the **Catalog** to see a list of the available connectors.

3. To configure the MQ connection, search for **IBM MQ** (1) and click **Connect** (2).

4. Click **Continue**.

5. Enter '**basicmq**' for the **Queue manager name** (1), '**basicmq-ibm-mq**' for the **Queue manager hostname** (2), and '**1414**' for the **Listener port number** (3).

6. Enter '**SYSTEM.DEF.SVRCONN**' for the **Channel name** (1), and click **Connect** (2).

7. Click **Continue**.

8. Click the **APIs** tab (1) and then the **+** icon (2).

9. Download the API definition for the external account service from here.
10. Select the downloaded **CustomerAccountOpenAPIJSONServer.yaml** file (1), and click **Next** (2).

11. Click **Add API**.

12. Expand the imported API (1), and click **Connect** (2).

13. Scroll down and click **Connect**.
**Import the flows**
1. Download the following two files:
• MQ flow to simulate the acquired bank
• Accounts API flow that CP4BA will use
2. Import each downloaded file by clicking the **Dashboard** icon (1), selecting **New** (2), and clicking **Import flow…** (3).

3. Add the downloaded **MQExternalProvider.yaml** file (1), and click **Import** (2).

4. Start the imported flow by selecting the menu at the top right (1), and clicking **Start flow** (2).

5. Repeat the process for the other downloaded **Accounts.yaml** file. This time, the flow is started by switching the toggle from **Stopped** to **Started**.

**Test the flow**
1. Click the **Dashboard** icon to return to the dashboard and view the imported flows.

2. Select the **Accounts** flow.

3. Select the **Test** tab (1), **Get /Accounts/{customerId}** operation (2), and then the **Try it** tab (3).

4. Scroll down and enter '**1234567890**' in the **customerId** field (1), and click **Send** (2).

5. The first test fails due to a known issue with the following error:

6. Click **Send** for a second time to receive the correct response.

7. To integrate the API into the Business Workflow, two environmentally specific pieces of information are required. Scroll to the top of the screen. Save the **URL** (1) and the **API Key** (2), both of which will be used later.
**[Go to top](#top)**
## **PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO: Cloud Pak for Business Automation**
1 - Open the account opening process in Process Designer

**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Log into Process Portal

**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Have the API Key handy

**[Go to top](#top)**
## **PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO: Cloud Pak for Integration**
1 - Log into Cloud Pak for Integration
1. Open **Cloud Pak for Integration** and click **IBM provided credentials (admin only)**.

2. Enter your admin username and password (1), and click **Log in** (2).

3. Click **Integration instances**.

4. On the **Integration instances** page, click **ace-designer-demo**.
**[Go to top](#top)**
*** Click [here](/300-enhancing-ba-with-integration/demo-script) to go to the **Demo script** on the next tab.
